location.merchant_description_html: Lekker is Dutch for "alluring, enticing and tempting" and aptly describes the inspiration behind our European portfolio of furniture, lighting, tabletop and accessories for the edited home. Visit us online or at our showroom in Boston's South End.

Aguacate Verde does the impossible: make delicious Mexican food healthy, so everyday is a splurge day. The meat is grilled, the beans are lard free and the food is still full of flavor! Start with the al Pastor’s grilled, juicy pork. Enjoy it stuffed in Pupusas (corn tortillas,) on a Taco, or sub style in a Torta. For the main event: Hot Tamales! Cooked piping hot in a leaf wrapper, open them for the joys inside like the Salvadorean that’s filled with chicken, loroco, wiskil and exotic veggies. Mm, olé!

Bill Belichick’s “homeless chic” hoodie sleeves did not originate in Foxborough Stadium...but in Dorchester. Diners are so consumed by the flavor and the hearty toppings at The Beach House, they forgo fashion to better attack their meal. You need all hands on deck to demolish plates that come with TWO sides! Who wants sleeves in their way when delving into The Hangover Pizza? No wonder it’s been dubbed “The Bloody Mary of pizzas”--It’s loaded with shaved steak, scrambly eggs, onions, peppers, cheese & hot sauce. Hail Mary!

We can't all afford to have celebrity trainer Mike Alexander whip us into shape, but the battle is 80% diet anyways, right? At Fuel, everything on the panini, wrap, and salad filled menu is under 500 calories, less than $10 and organic. A fully stocked juice bar and creative dishes like the T.B.M Stacker- a tomato, mozzarella & basil stack drizzled with olive oil and a balsamic reduction, remind you that eating healthy can be delicious. In no time you'll look like Jessica Simpson in her Daisy Duke days.

Brandeis students may have rated this place Best Pizza in ‘09, but that’s probably just because undergrads don’t wake up before noon. Prime Deli’s breakfast menu is worth setting an alarm. Ditch the Pop-Tart and devour a breakfast sandwich like the Red Sox Special (home fries, bacon, ham and eggs) or the Triple Threat (bacon, ham, sausage and eggs on a baguette.) And admit it, after an all nighter, you know you’d trade in a 90 min power nap for a hot plate of Texas French Toast or Chocolate Chip Pancakes.

Let’s go ahead and address the elephantine calzone in the room. Dude…you’re HUGE! As perplexing as it is to ponder the ways you fit steak, pepperoni, sausage, mozzarella AND ricotta into that crispy dome of yours, even more baffling is the fact that Garrett Hill’s humongo Cheesesteaks have the perfect steak/cheese ratio. Listen, if you guys get any bigger (or tastier) there’ll hardly be space for me to sit and enjoy my doughy-crusted Margherita or Upside Down Pizza (with sauce on top!) Cool it, will ya?

Fresh oysters and raw delights. Boozy slushies. A wood bar (made from a single fallen tree.)  Upscale bar food! This must be the South End. No? Back Bay? No! Where is this mod paradise? Abigail’s in KENDALL SQUARE. That’s right 9-to-5ers, queue the Ferris Bueller parade, you can now ask your co-worker to “grab a drink” sans evil glares & relentless scoffing. And Abigail’s is quality, the pride of Jason Lord (of East Coast Grill pedigree.) With a BBQ Brunch in the works, I’d say it’s time to stock up on the confetti.

It’s the classic story. Boy meets girl. Girl offers boy world rockin’ Mexican fusion food. Boy vows never again to eat at Taco Bell. They fall in love, open a fresh, lively Cantina and the next thing you know, they’re making Honey Cholula Wings, Coconut Habanero Shrimp, Chipotle Peanut BBQ Pork Sandwiches and Chicken Sweet Potato Burrito babies filled to the brim with avocado, pinto beans, guajillo chile sauce, cheese, lettuce & tomato. Modelo and Margarita, may your love, and my belly, forever grow.

“I’m gonna make you an offer you can’t refuse.” Those fateful words led to my lunch meeting at Domenic’s with the enticing Parma. Imported black label parma ham, basil marinated tomatoes, and fresh mozz on crusty ciabatta bread made that morning. Just when I think I’m out, they pull me back in lunch after lunch. The Dom Special- an Italian with sweet capicola and prosciutto. I devour it and I know my loyalty is forever Domenic’s. I see a note on my napkin, “After your sub, leave the gun. Take a Cannoli.”

Get juiced after your workout with a refreshing shake from the full service Juice Bar inside City Fitness!  Shakes are made from the skins, seeds and pulp of vine-ripened fruit, can you say FRESH?!  Each shake combines protein and other supplements that are both tasty and effective. The bar offers specific recipes designed fat loss, muscle building, meal replacement, even healthy snacking! Step up to the counter and let a juice bar specialists personalize a shake for you!

Trivia Tuesday? Check. Fri and Sat night dancing? Check. Boston sports teams on TV? Check. Free wi-fi? We’ll take it. Joco’s has passed the neighborhood bar checklist. With 14 beers on tap and 30+ bottles, you’ll be sure to find a Little Sumpin’ Sumpin’ to sip on. For those who prefer booze served in triangle shaped glasses, Joco’s Martinis are house specialities. And in case you want something solid in your mouth, they have a full menu with everything from Antipasto to Hot Dogs. Tonight let’s go to Joco!

Dasiwa’s custom drinks and candy inspired lattes made with Philly’s own world-renowned La Colombe beans will give you the caffeine jolt you need to finish all the chores your stepmom gave you. At noon, Dasiwa pulls a Cinderella and the unpretentious coffee shop transforms into a BYOB sushi bar. High caliber, creative rolls include the spicy tuna/seared tuna/mango Picasso and the spicy salmon/jalapeno Rising Sun. Super fresh fish at modest prices is magic. No fairy godmother required.

Not just groceries, Jay's Deli in Washington Square is making awesome Hoagies with prime ingredients: Boar's Head meat, Le Bus rolls, even lettuce that's actually green! If you're sick of Cap'n Crunch & pixy stick sandwiches for Saturday detention lunch, try a Veggie Hoagie, hummus, or one of many premade vegan wraps. So stop gnawing on your fingers. If you keep eating your hand, you're not gonna be hungry for lunch.

I need a new curryeer. Until now, my stomach has worked for bland foods, but it wants signing bonuses like Indian spices. So, we’re going to take our digestive talents to Curry House. They’ve got better benefits—entrees like the yogurt-marinated Chicken Tandoori shimmied in spices or the Channa Masala with garbanzo beans, onions, tomatoes, and sensational seasoning. The Luncheon Buffet (everyday, 11:30 AM to 3 PM) is the cherry on top of Curry House’s Mango Ice Cream. Mid-life digestive crisis: Averted.

You’ve got $20 and need a “Happy Hour at Hooters is not appropriate for an anniversary dinner” arrangement ASAP? Just learned Martha Stewart’s Secrets of Flower Arranging and are excited to build your own bouquet? No problem! This flower shop does it all. The friendly foliage experts will make smile inducing bunches of blooms, help find the perfect “pink, purple, orangey greenish” colored bud and even give you access to a cool vault where fresh cut flowers are stored. You’ll be glad-i-ola you came in!

I’d take a bullet for you. And by that I mean a toasty Pesto Turkey Bullet from Quiznos--with less than 500 calories. I promise you all the sweet Cantina Chicken Flatbread Sammies you desire, with Chili on the side. If you’re down for a sleepover, we can come back in the AM for a Bacon, Egg & Cheddar Sub. Still not convinced I love you? What if I said I’d take a Torpedo for you—with Beef, Bacon, & Cheddar? As long as it’s Quiznos—when it comes to the real bullets, you’re on your own. I don’t do guns.

We at Paris Creperie have a passion for crepes. Years ago, when owner Chuck Silverston was vacationing in Paris, he got his first taste of a world famous street food. He found something uniquely special in the grand ambience of one of the world's oldest cities. Simple yet traditional ingredients combined in a fresh crepe spun by a street vendor created a new experience that he knew would be a big hit across the ocean.

10 years have passed since then, and Paris Creperie has become a mainstay in Brookline's historic Coolidge Corner. Amidst the backwash of a bustling business community, anyone can escape for a moment to our quaint café to enjoy a small taste of France, a terrific cup of coffee, or our ever popular smoothie selection.

Our newest adventure is the creation of New England's first crepe truck, aptly titled "La Tour Eiffel." Surprisingly enough, our mobile crepe kitchen is closer to the traditional street vendor originally discovered all those years ago. Whether it's serving the denizens of Boston, Brookline, or a privately catered function, we confidently stand behind our motto: 
We Bring Paris to You!

Au revoir, and we hope to serve you soon!

Two minutes left in the 4th quarter at DiBlasi Field. The Pats are down by a field goal. On the sideline, The Belichicken shouts a play. “Grilled chicken pesto panini! Fresh Mozza! Peppers! CHIPS!!” Tom Brady nods. HIKE! Brady draws back and throws a Steak Bomb downfield, brimming with peppers, onions, mushrooms, salami and cheese. Spectators hold their breath. COMPLETION! The Steako Cinco makes the catch and runs for a touchdown with steak and 5 cheeses! Another win! Wraps and Sicilian Pizza for all!

I returned to my table to find my House Doner Chicken Kumpir from Firinji stolen! Understandably—that enormous bowled potato dressed with seasoning, cheese, peppers and corn fiesta always tempts my table neighbors. It’s one of many sexy items on Firinji’s rad fusion menu! I look around at people nom-ing on Steak Shish Kababs, Flatbreads and fruit Smoothies. I will find this Kumpir-monger! Was it you, sir to my right? You look suspiciously satisfied. Enjoy my mean side eye while I enjoy my Fruzi…

When I go to Salumeria Cheese Shop in Reading Terminal Market, I’m in full-on cougar mode. Most of the dairy-laden jewels are aged, but not nearly as old as I am. Grating cheeses like American Grana fill my nostrils with wafts of parmesan. Mandaroni Provolone seduces me with Italian. Then, I spot La Tur. Its gentle texture and creamy blend of cow, goat and sheep milk seals the deal. No worries, this cougar goes through cheese quick. I’ll be back to take home another one of you hunks next week.

Sebastians is a local, family-owned business that serves the freshest, finest American and International fare to the Boston and Cambridge, Massachusetts communities.  Our cafés in Boston and Cambridge serve health conscience menus for breakfast, coffee, and lunch, while providing drop-off corporate catering to businesses, and special event catering to the Commonwealth.

I guess you could say we are Wicked Fresh! ;)
location.name: Summer Street

location.merchant_description_html: “Listen to your body,” they say. “It will tell you what food your system needs.” Well, “they” clearly don’t understand my internal conflict: my body craves a Thanksgiving dinner of turkey, stuffing, mashed pots and cranberry--but my mind screams PIZZA! Thankfully, 13th St. Gourmet Pizza’s “The Pilgrim” deep dish only scratches the surface of their audacious crush-every-craving pies. Wings, salads, wraps and pasta finish the smorgasbord of satisfaction. But trust your eyes when you see it's open ‘til 4AM--it’s true!

The Main Line’s got a self-serve setup that lets you crank out 12 flavors of froyo like Red Velvet, PB, Pom Ras, Banana, Cheesecake and Original with seasonal favorites making guest star appearances. Be proactive and swirl your froyo with a hole in the middle so you can cram in over 50 of your favorite fruit, candy, cereal, nuts and boba toppings. 60s style mod seating is available if your froyo creation is too heavy to carry home. And with Funnel Cake and Soft Pretzels on the menu, how can you Top This!?

To mark a restaurant with the golden fork of brunch excellence, you don’t need moody decor, lux linens and a 2-hour wait. You DO need decadent Praline Pancakes, fluffy brioche-based French Toast and perfectly cooked Eggs Benny (with banana pecan syrup for all!) And you can’t include the “unch” of brunch without a Thai Style Grilled Prawn Salad and the “Build Your Own Burger Bar.” So, skip the pricey brunch scene and hit this understated, overly delicious eatery from 7AM-2:30PM--inside the Chancellor Hotel!

There once were Tres Jalapenos. Jalapeno 1 lived in the Carne Asada, furnished with grilled steak & tortilla (and BYO tequila!) The Badass Wolf came and said “I’ll huff and I’ll puff, and I’ll swallow it down!” And so he did. Jalapeno 2 lived at the Tres Jalapenos Brunch, where he gave everyone a free Mimosa, Margarita or Coffee. The Wolf finished him off, too. Finally, Jalapeno 3 lived at Taco Tuesday—unlimited tacos for $13.95! The Wolf ate and ate until his stomach burst, and that was the end of that.

Drink | Eat | Hang | Hide. The red glow of Rogues Gallery Bar illuminates an underground Philly movement—a break from the bar monotony that plagues the city. There’s nothing like a good drink paired with a loaded Pizza Burger or lightly-breaded Fish & Chips featuring flounder and tots—especially at cheap prices. But don’t leave when you’re done! Hang for awhile! Feel the DJ's vibes, grab another drink and weave yourself into a mixed crowd full of people and stories. Let loose, go rogue.

Wake up East Cambridge, there’s a new breakfast spot in the neighborhood. Cafe Kafofo is a bright sunny spot to start your day...seriously, there are orange walls and huge windows overlooking Cambridge Street! The new cafe on the block proudly serves Jim’s Organic Coffee as well as muffins, scones and pastries from Curtis St. Bakery. But it’s not just tasty imports, Cafe Kafofo puts their spin delicious sandwiches and hot drinks as well. The star of their in-house specials? The Chicken Salad Sandwich. Yes, it’s the good “did my mom make this?” kind...chock full of grapes and almonds.

If you expect frosted treats at Johnny Cupcakes, you’re in for a surprise. The glass pastry case in this pseudo bakery is filled with sweet (and exclusive!) apparel. Tees and tanks. Pins and pencils. Hats and hoodies. The cake n’ crossbones emblem knows no limits! Johnny Cupcakes serves up fresh designs daily, but once a piece is sold out, it’s never produced again! Fun fact: The brand’s swift rise to cult status occurred without funding, mainstream advertising or the help of chain stores. Everything is genuinely fierce!

Hats and hoodies. The cake n’ crossbones emblem knows no limits! Johnny Cupcakes serves up fresh designs daily, but once a piece is sold out, it’s never produced again!
